chapter.title: System Requirements and Installation

abstract.para:
This chapter describes:
on which computers &dapsacr; will work,
how to install &dapsacr; on &osuse;, and
how to build and install &dapsacr; on other Linux* distributions.

chapter.sect1:
Installation &daps-install;
Installing &dapsacr; on &osuse; &daps-install-osuse;
Installing &dapsacr; on Other Linux Distributions
For installation on other Linux distributions, the &dapsacr; sources are available as a TAR archive. They can be installed with configure, make, and make install.
Installing the &dapsacr; Sources
Before starting the installation, check the &dapsacr; and make sure all required packages and tools are installed.
Go to and download the &dapsacr; source TAR archive, daps-version_number.tar.bz2.
Unpack the TAR archive:
$ tar -xvf daps-version_number.tar.bz2
Change to the newly created daps subdirectory and start the configure script:
$ ./configure
If you want to adjust the &dapsacr; installation paths:
View the available options with
$ ./configure --help
Run the configure script with the desired option.
The script checks your system for any software relevant to &dapsacr; and the &dapsacr; installation process. It also creates a makefile that will be used during installation. Based on the analysis, the script shows a summary that includes the following information:
the &dapsacr; installation paths,
an overview of &dapsacr; features that will be available on your system if you install &dapsacr; now, and
which software is still missing to enable the remaining &dapsacr; features.
Check the summary carefully.
Install missing packages, if necessary. After installing new packages, repeat and check the summary again.
If everything is prepared according to your wishes, enter:
$ make
Start the installation process with:
$ sudo make install
